item.title: Category II Expertise in Sociology
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluation of the Sector Policy Support Programme ‘Promoting mutual trade by removing technical barriers to trade between Ukraine and the European Union’

The specific purpose for undertaking this evaluation is to evaluate the Technical Barriers to Trade in Sector Budget Support according to the standard OECD criteria and finally study the effects of EU-funded cooperation in the area of technical barriers to trade on the business climate in Ukraine and of the perceptions by the business community of the reforms supported by the TBT SBS and other EU-funded programmes on the subject.

As a matter of fact, systematic and timely evaluation of its programmes, activities, instruments, legislation and non-spending activities is a priority of the European Commission in order to demonstrate accountability and to promote lesson learning to improve policy and practice.

The generic purpose of the evaluation is to identify key lessons and to produce recommendations to improve current and inform future choices on the sector reform contracts in Ukraine and on the cooperation between the EU in Ukraine in the sphere of the removal of technical barriers in the trade in industrial goods.

Project duration: 130 days (until May 2017)

Category II Expertise in Sociology – 45 working days

Qualifications and skills

  • Master’s degree in a field related to the assignment – economic, social or legal sciences - or at least extra 5 years of experience additional to that described below under the general professional experience;
  • Excellent English communication skills, both spoken and written.
  • Knowledge of Ukrainian (or Russian) would be a very strong asset;

General Professional experience

  • at least 6 years of relevant professional experience in sociology;
  • professional experience in development cooperation will be an asset;

Specific professional experience:

  • At least 2 years of practical experience in designing, implementation and analysis of sociological polls;
  • Practical experience in application of the focus groups tool.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com

item.title: Value Chain Specialist (Category II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Formulation of the ARISE+ Project

On November 3, 2016, the draft Action Document of ARISE+ will be presented to the Quality Support Group of the European Commission Directorate for Development and Cooperation. Comments received during this consultation will be incorporated in a revised draft Action Document that will be made available to and finalised by the experts. A second Quality Support Group will take place tentatively on March 7, 2017 before a final decision on ARISE+ is reached by Q3 of 2017.

The mission’s main objective is to assist the EU Delegation to Vietnam formulate the ARISE+ Programme in Vietnam with a focus on its support to private sector component.

The mission will identify the list of priorities where the programme’s scarce resources should be allocated. This includes the list of sectors most likely to benefit from support to access markets in the EU, with maximum impact on job creation and poverty reduction.

Value Chain Specialist (Category II) (25 working days)

  • At least a Masters Degree in Economics, Business, Trade or another relevant discipline. In its absence, 10 years professional experience working on private sector support and export promotion in developing countries.
  • At least 6 years experience on Trade, Standards and/or Private sector support;
  • Experience working with business organisations or producers organisations in Vietnam.
  • In-depth knowledge of at least three value chains in Vietnam. - Strong references on export promotion in Vietnam.
  • Previous experience on EU market access is an advantage.
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a multicultural environment
  • Excellent level of English.
  • Good knowledge of Vietnamese.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Lina_Forgeaux@dai.com

item.title: Category III Expert

item.description:
Description of Project

The Global Objective of this evaluation is to provide the project stakeholders, primarily the EU Delegation to Laos, with sufficient information about the project performance of the Pool Fund (its relevancy, efficiency, effectiveness, impacts and sustainability), document lessons learned and provide practical recommendations for future programmes.

The Specific Objectives are built on five key parameters for the evaluator to study; and these are:relevance, efficiency, effectives, impact and sustainability as described below:

  • Assess the relevance of the project design (its activities and objectives) in addressing the priority issues in the target communities;
  • Assess to what extent the available resources have been used economically in delivering the project outputs/results, in terms of quantity, quality and timeliness (efficiency).
  • Assess the major achievements of the project to date in relation to its stated objectives and intended results based on the logframe (effectiveness);
  • Assess to what extent the project is contributing to a long-term positive effect on the entire society in the uplands (impact);
  • Assess whether the positive outcomes of the project are likely to continue after the project (sustainability).
